metadata.jobDescription:
Sr. Product Manager for Walrus, owning the core data platform and key product
surfaces including Walrus Sites. Role sits at intersection of storage, data delivery,
and developer experience. Responsible for developer-facing abstractions (APIs, SDKs,
tooling, documentation), working with engineering on performance/scalability/reliability,
and supporting internal teams + external partners adopting Walrus in production.

Key requirements: 5+ years PM experience on technical platform/infrastructure products,
proven ownership of ambiguous problems end-to-end, strong technical fluency with APIs/
data flows/system design, experience leading multi-quarter initiatives. Nice to have:
ecosystem shaping experience, content/media/AI/data monetization exposure, security/
privacy/governance familiarity, open-source involvement.

hero.status: Open to Platform PM roles — Distributed Storage, Developer Infrastructure, Web3
hero.subheadline: Senior PM with 8+ years building infrastructure products developers love. From RPC APIs serving 1M+ daily requests to SDK ecosystems for gaming studios— I turn complex distributed systems into reliable, scalable platforms. Passionate about the intersection of storage, data delivery, and developer experience.

about.tagline: Eight years shipping infrastructure products that developers build on—from enterprise blockchain at Microsoft to institutional staking platforms. I find PMF in technical markets and turn engineering excellence into developer adoption.
bio:
Currently at Anchorage Digital, I own staking infrastructure serving billions in AUM with zero slashing events. I've shipped 7+ L2 integrations (Optimism, Base, Arbitrum) using a RICE evaluation framework I built, reducing integration time by 40%. Before that, at Ankr I drove 15× revenue growth ($130K to $2M ARR) by repositioning RPC infrastructure from developers to protocols—building Advanced APIs and an SDK that scaled to 1M+ daily requests. At Forte, I designed Wallet-as-a-Service SDKs with MPC custody for AAA gaming studios.
At Dapper Labs, I led Flow CLI and Cadence Playground to reduce developer onboarding time by 60%. I started at Microsoft shipping Xbox royalties on Ethereum—one of the first production smart contracts in enterprise. Walrus's mission resonates deeply: I've spent my career making complex infrastructure accessible to developers, building the platforms that ecosystems depend on. I understand what it takes to evolve a protocol product from early adoption to production maturity while balancing performance, reliability, and developer experience.

caseStudies.reasoning: API infrastructure at scale, SDK development, developer tools, 15x revenue growth—directly parallel to Walrus platform PM responsibilities
Flow CLI and developer tools—exact match for Walrus developer-facing abstractions and tooling work
Infrastructure platform with reliability/performance requirements—demonstrates platform thinking and technical depth
Multi-quarter initiatives with cross-functional teams, framework building—relevant for Walrus ecosystem expansion
Pioneering blockchain infrastructure, enterprise production systems—shows ability to bring new technology to production

projects.reasoning: Framework development demonstrates builder mentality and system design skills
Developer tools for blockchain—directly relevant to Walrus Sites and developer experience
